channel.title: Eclipse Plugins, Bundles and Products - Eclipse Marketplace

item.title: Synopsys Code Sight
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Fri, 2019-03-01 18:27
Synopsys Inc
Date Created: 
Fri, 2019-02-15 16:30
Submitted by: 
Synopsys Code Sight

The Synopsys® Code Sight™ plug-in helps identify quality bugs and security vulnerabilities in your software. Using the Coverity Static Analysis tool, it automatically highlights those issues in the development-environment editor as you code. Connecting to a Synopsys server improves scan performance and enables your entire development team to collaborate on writing better code faster. In the future the plug-in will support our other products starting with Black Duck for SCA and Seeker for IAST. These plugins can be downloaded from their respective marketplaces, either from within each IDE or via the links below. 

Please check with your admin on the scope of the solution needed for your projects. If you need any assistance with purchasing a license, please email support@synopsys.com.

Documentation for Installation, Getting Started, etc. can be found here: https://community.synopsys.com/s/code-sight-hub

Please click here to read the Synopsys End User License Agreement.
item.dc:creator: scodesight

item.title: Design and Verification Tools (DVT) IDE for e, SystemVerilog, VHDL, and PSS
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Fri, 2019-03-01 11:55
AMIQ EDA
Date Created: 
Wed, 2006-04-19 08:00
Submitted by: 
AMIQ Support

Design and Verification Tools (DVT) is an integrated development environment (IDE) for the design and verification engineers working with SystemVerilog, Verilog, VHDL, e, UPF, CPF, SLN, PSS, SDL. Including Universal Verification Methodology (UVM) support. It is similar to well-known programming tools like Visual Studio®, NetBeans®, and IntelliJ®. DVT comprises a proprietary IEEE standard-compliant parser, a smart code editor, an intuitive GUI, a comprehensive set of features that help with code inspection, navigation, documentation, and debugging, and an innovative linting framework. DVT allows design and verification engineers to overcome the limitations of plain text editors and use a modern and powerful tool that enables them to:

  • Increase the speed and quality of new code development
  • Easily understand complex or poorly documented source code
  • Simplify the maintenance of legacy code and reusable libraries
  • Accelerate language and methodology learning
  • Automatically generate well-organized source code documentation

 

FEATURES Some of the features that DVT offers include:

  • Compilation errors signaled on the fly
  • Autocomplete / Content Assist
  • Customizable code and project templates
  • Dedicated wizards to generate getters and setters, override functions, or help with UVM factory registration
  • Hyperlinks
  • Semantic Search and Show Usages
  • Quick fixes / Autocorrect
  • Refactoring
  • Macro expansion
  • Project database query views (types, macros, checks, etc.)
  • Structural views (type hierarchy, design hierarch, call hierarchy, etc.)
  • Signal tracing
  • UML and TLM diagrams for inspecting and documenting the verification environment
  • Schematic, trace, state machine diagrams for inspecting and documenting the design
  • Dedicated UVM support
  • Cross-language capabilities for mixed-language projects
  • In-line reminders for task tracking (TO DOs)
  • Vi and emacs emulation

 

INTEGRATION WITH OTHER TOOLS Since it is built on the Eclipse Platform, the DVT IDE can be easily integrated within a large plug-in ecosystem. It also integrates seamlessly with all major hardware simulators such as NCSim , Specman , VCS , and Questa, to enable simplified simulation analysis and debugging. In addition, it works with revision control systems like CVS, Git, Subversion, ClearCase and bug tracking systems such as Bugzilla and ClearQuest.
RESOURCES

 

  • DVT Eclipse IDE Web Page
  • DVT Eclipse IDE Datasheet
  • Demo movies
  • DVT Debugger Add-on
item.dc:creator: emisingname6ia

item.title: Personalized Eclipse IDE Bug Prioritizer
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Fri, 2019-03-01 07:00
vogella GmbH
Date Created: 
Thu, 2019-02-28 12:46
Submitted by: 
Jennifer Nerlich

This Plug-in offers the following features:

  • A view which shows bug reports and feature requests (requirements) from bugs.eclipse.org personalized for the current user
  • A view which show the most discussed bugs in the last 30 days from bugs.eclipse.org

As for the personalized prioritisation of requirements: The user can see directly in the Eclipse IDE, in the 'Bug Prioritizer' View, which requirements would be of interests for him/her and also in interest for the community and good for the Eclipse project. After the user enters his Email Address, Eclipse Project, and Components of interest in the settings page, the user gets a personalized and prioritized list of bugs.

The user can dislike, like and snooze bugs. If a bug is disliked it will be deleted from his list and the algorithm will learn that this was not a good choice for the user. If a bug is liked, this will help the algorithm to learn out of it and try to find similar bugs. If a bug is snoozed, this would mean, that it was actually a good choice from the algorithm, but for the time being the user doesnt want to work on this bug and it will be shown again in x days. The snooze period can be defined in the settings page.

The more the user likes and dislikes bugs, the better will become the results of the algorithm for the user.

As for the most discussed bugs: Users will see the bugs with the largest amount of comments in the last 30 days for a specified Product - Component combination in the 'Most discussed bugs' view.
item.dc:creator: jnerlich

item.title: AttackFlow
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Thu, 2019-02-28 17:34
AttackFlow
Date Created:

AttackFlow provides an interactive way of secure coding. Putting developing secure code to its right place.

       Key Features

  • In-place finding explanations increasing security falsification awareness complementing security trainings.
  • Fits right along with the agility of DevOps teams minimally interrupting the process notifying as the developers code.
  • The findings include actionable mitigation and code snippets.
  • Being an Eclipse Plugin, it is easy to install AttackFlow and it runs seamlessly in the right place.

If you want to buy AttackFlow contact us at: info@attackflow.com

Visit Company Website: https://www.attackflow.com/
item.dc:creator: cozdenpuq

item.title: Groovy Development Tools
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Thu, 2019-02-28 11:42
Pivotal
Date Created: 
Wed, 2012-07-04 13:05
Submitted by: 
Andrew Clement

The Groovy Development Tools (GDT) provides Eclipse and Maven support for the Apache Groovy programming language. GDT adds full-featured IDE support including editors, wizards, content assist, debugging, refactoring and searching.

The GDT requires the Eclipse Java Development Tools (JDT) as it builds upon Java/JVM support, including Java interoperability (bi-directional dependencies via joint compilation). If your Eclipse flavor does not include JDT, you must install it first.

GDT does not provide any direct support for Grails. If you want Grails tooling, then please consider Groovy-Grails Tools Suite or spring-projects/grails-ide for your Grails projects.
item.dc:creator: aclement

item.title: SDMapGen
item.description:
Submitted by: 
Alberto Fuentes
Date Updated: 
Thu, 2019-02-28 11:23
Date Created: 
Sun, 2017-05-28 18:15

SDMapGen is a code generator for mapping between beans from an approach of simplicity of use, that is the reason for being integrated in Eclipse as a plugin. it generates while you are coding so you can review the mapping and adjust it while coding, directly in Java and into the classes where it should be.

item.title: SAP Commerce Cloud - Developer Toolset Plugin
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Thu, 2019-02-28 07:05
EPAM Systems
Date Created: 
Mon, 2017-02-06 12:53
Submitted by: 
EPAM Systems

Ready to optimize your SAP Commerce Cloud (formerly known as SAP Hybris Commerce) development environment?

EPAM’s SAP Commerce Cloud - Developer Toolset Plugin for Eclipse enables SAP Commerce Cloud code to be imported, manipulated and worked with directly in Eclipse, resulting in enhanced productivity and code quality.

The plugin lets users work with common SAP Commerce Cloud items, such as ImpEx files and flexible search queries, directly within Eclipse. It makes it easy to import and update extensions and their dependencies into the Eclipse workspace.

The plugin offers:

  • A custom code editing environment with built-in auto-complete that simplifies writing fresh code and ensures proper syntax
  • Automatic code validation from across multiple ImpEx
  • Easy import of specific SAP Commerce Cloud extensions, along with their dependencies
  • Quick creation and run-time of simple queries without subqueries or join statements
  • Ability to generate SAP Commerce Cloud-specific classes
  • Ability to run or validate ImpEx on remote servers
  • Solr search console which allows the execution of Solr queries directly from Eclipse
  • And much more!

Read more about SAP Commerce Cloud Developer Toolset for Eclipse

Watch the overview video about SAP Commerce Cloud Developer Toolset for Eclipse

This plugin has been created by experienced SAP Commerce Cloud developers from EPAM’s SAP Customer Experience (CX) Competency Center, the same team that brought you the #1 SAP Commerce Cloud technical blog, hybrismart.com. This plugin represents the battle-tested lessons of those developers from dozens of SAP Commerce Cloud implementations spanning platform versions (v4.x to current release), global geography, multiple industries and complex solution types (B2C, B2B, B2B2C, PIM/PCM, etc.).  

EPAM is invested in making SAP Commerce Cloud development more efficient and productive. If you have feedback, suggestions or requests, please send them to hybriseclipseplugin@epam.com.

EPAM is an SAP Platinum Partner and has created a long line of SAP Commerce Cloud-centric accelerators, extensions, connectors, microservices and plugins. Interested in getting involved and joining this global team? Learn more at https://www.epam.com/careers/hybris-talent.
item.dc:creator: esystems

item.title: ALIAS SCREEN DESIGNER for Eclipse
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Thu, 2019-02-28 04:55
Sun i-Tech
Date Created: 
Mon, 2016-01-18 10:33
Submitted by: 
Evelyne Roseta

Alias Screen Designer is the ultimate dynamic HTML5 forms builder for Eclipse that helps developers generate stunning JSP and PHP pages. Fully WYSIWIG and no programming required ! Just draw, simulate and generate your dynamic pages. Dynamic HTML pages designers know how complex their developement and evolution over time can be. Built with industrial CAD (Computerized Assisted Design) tools in mind, Alias Screen Designer Plug-in gives you a user-friendly and ergonomical workspace to ease the creation of all your dynamic HTML 5 pages (JSP and PHP formats). 1- Download Alias Screen Designer plug-in for Eclipse. Register now to enjoy a free 1-year licence and free annual renewals ! 2 -Just draw and be creative. A large catalogue of objects available : Text fields, input/output fields, images (fixed, variable), combo box, group box, check box, charts, buttons (push, radio) etc. You may design all kind of tables from standard grid to stuning zebra-striping looks, and including the possibility to add sub-arrays. You can even add search features and apply animated effects. Depending on the type of target devices (PC, Tablet, Mobile), the form template will adjust. Field control : In connexion with the Eclipse IDE, Alias Screnn Designer allows you not only to set up graphic properties for each field but also all controls that should satisfy data capture. Therefore, your dynamic HTML 5 pages integrate verifications such as values, formats, etc. Calculation and dependency functions : You may define a field as the result of a calculation that won’t call upon the server. You may also set up constrains between fields. By using these functions, you optimize server exchanges by lowering server traffic. Display control interactions : In just a few clicks, you set up interactions between fields : actions on one or more fields, controling display parameters : visible, hided, editable or not, enabled or not. This control is done dynamically according to rules. CSS import : With Alias Screen Designer, you can import your own CSS to go along with your corporate graphic chart. And you may also insert iframes and all kind of widgets into your pages ! If you want to learn more about Alias Screen Designer visit our website : http://www.sunitech.eu/plug-ins-eclipse_en.php

WARNING ! Do NOT register your license with a Yahoo email account. For unclear technical reasons, Yahoo account users don't always receive our notifications (activation code, emails from technical support and so on). Please use an email address from alternative email address providers.
item.dc:creator: eroseta
